About the Business

Established in 2018. The owners, Steve and Jean, started this business as a smaller eatery known as Hometown Chinese Restaurant in 1990. Since then, it has evolved and grown over the decades into a larger business that now focuses on serving various Taiwanese classics.…

    It's tough to find Taiwanese restaurants around anywhere, let alone authentic ones....this MAY be the one? I feel like ordering food here once isn't quite enough for me to discern but I have a good feeling this will be the place I keep coming back to.

    Hometown Taiwanese has a gorgeous website and it's easy to order online/over the phone. There's an extra 50 cent charge for using a credit card no matter the price of your order. I also got charged a service fee (99 cents) and I'm bot sure if that's because I used online ordering?

    Food: the taste was pretty legit in terms of Taiwanese flavouring and it's also very affordable. Portion sizes are big and can definitely be split into two meals. Not pictured is rose milk tea boba half sugar which tasted good but not amazing, and pork gravy over rice, a super classic Taiwanese dish that was cheap, hearty, and tastes delicious. Highly recommend. The Szechuan pig ears were spicy for me (I have zero spice tolerance) but my bff said she liked that she could taste it/not have it be overwhelmingly spicy.

    Definitely a great couple of meals and I will definitely be back!

    Husband chose this restaurant for a date night dinner. I was a little skeptical but after reading some of the Yelp reviews was excited to try it.

    We ordered pork fried rice, pork & bok choy dumplings & spicy basil chicken. Everything was delicious! Portions were very generous. I have a new favorite pork fried rice now. It's very well seasoned and flavorful but not a heavy rice, if that makes sense. The spicy chicken & basil was a complete surprise as we didn't have a clue what to expect. It was sweet, spicy, flavorful and we couldn't get enough! The dumplings and spicy dipping sauce were something new for us but definitely did not disappoint. A must try!

    Can't wait to return and try more items. The lady at the counter was very helpful answering all my questions about what things were so I know what to try next time. I'm typically a creature of habit and tend to order what I already know I'll like but will force myself to try something new next time.

    chicken drumstick over rice: $10.75
    we got two of these dishes and WOW can i say that this is a huge dish. super hard for one person to finish and they give very generous portions! would definitely recommend this because of how juicy it is. the only downside is i wish that they used minced braised pork on top of the rice. that's the only thing missing to their menu in my opinion!
    beef noodle soup (spicy): my dad got this and it wasnt too spicy. i dont think it was anything special but they finished the dish.

    price - **these prices are from the 2019 menu**
    average prices for downtown davis. pretty good for the portions!
    dumplings: $9.95
    chicken leg over rice: $10.75
    beef noodle soup: $10.50

    service -
    this is ran more like a fast restaurant. you order up front and your food will come out. waters, utensils, etc are for you to grab!

    When I went to Hometown a week ago, the male employee (I'm assuming husband) was serving food, talking, and walking around the kitchen looking at the food ALL WITHOUT A MASK. I walked inside two times and never once saw him with a mask on, and saw him serve food without a mask on WHILE talking over the food to his customer in an exclamatory voice which I assume increases the chance of him accidentally spitting.

    This is a huge safety violation because he is putting everyone at risk that gets food from here. How hard is it to wear a mask especially when you're working in the food industry where lots of people eat your food? He could be the sole reason why a mini outbreak happens.
    If he has a health condition that prevents him from wearing a mask, why not notify your customers so they can factor that risk in before they order food? This violation is seriously a life or death situation because you don't know how the virus is going to affect your customers or the people they interact with like roommates or family.

    Now the good part? His, who I assume wife, however, seemed to be following the coronavirus guidelines well. She was wearing a mask the entire time I was there. I guess it's also nice to note that there was hand sanitizer where you pick up food. It's the least they could do after putting us all at risk.

  • Michelle W.

    Elite '2021

    Sacramento, CA
    173
    56
    375
    3/23/2019
    5 photos

    A great addition to Davis' growing Asian food repertoire! The rice plate portions are amazing!

    LOCATION/PARKING: We went on a Saturday right after they opened (around 11:30am). It was pretty empty so we got a spot right in front.

    ATMOSPHERE: Good amount of seating and they had nice big tables for big parties.

    SERVICE: It's counter-service, so you order at the register and they'll give you a number for your order.

    FOOD: We ordered the pork chive dumplings, pork chop over rice and the chicken drumstick over rice. The dumplings were pretty disappointing, but the rice dishes more than made up for that.

    There were 15 dumplings and they were fairly small. They had way more chives than meat and I was unable to taste the pork because I was overwhelmed with the chive/ginger flavor. The sauce also had too much vinegar which didn't lend well to the dumplings.

    Now for the good, the pork chop had two generous pieces and were perfectly crispy. The rice portion was great and the sauce added a good flavor to the dish. I wish there had been more of it since the pork chop could've used a little more seasoning. The added egg was bomb. I crushed up and mixed it into the rice. I liked that the rice plates also had a little bit of green beans and pickled veggie, which gave the dish a little bit of welcomed acid. I would definitely order it again!

    The chicken drumstick was definitely the highlight. It was cooked perfectly and the crispy, lightly fatty skin had seasoning that was similar to roast duck, which is one of my all time favorite foods! I would highly recommend this dish.

    I liked that they offered milk tea combo deals for the rice dishes we got for about $2 more. I'll probably try that next time.

    We also ended up ordering pea sprouts to go because it's our favorite veggie so we couldn't help ourselves. Lol It was $13.50 and the portion wasn't too big, it was a tad saltier than I would've liked as well. It would make a good side to the rice plates though!

    PRICE: The dishes we got were around $10. The rice dishes were worth it. The dumplings weren't however. The prices for their newer menu weren't especially low, so hopefully the portions will make up for it. I look forward to trying more.

    See all photos from Michelle W. for Hometown Taiwanese Kitchen & Bar

    The BEST restaurant in Davis hands down. Frankly, this is a must try. Not only this is the only Taiwanese restaurant in the surrounding area, It's one of the very few restaurants which maintains the authenticity of the cuisine. Their black bean chicken, schezwan fush, spicy sole fish fillet, cumin lamb, sauteed lamb, cumin beef, kung pao shrimp, pork chops, chicken leg quarter over tice with pork curry are to die for. They have a secret hot sauce which you have to ask for which is absolutely fantastic. If you are up for spicy food ask them for "extra spicy" and they will make it so. Portions are pretty large.

    Davis, CA

    ROTD 3/17/2019

    It's awesome to have Hometown back! This little restaurant serves up comforting Taiwanese dishes that always hit the spot. The portion size (especially for the chicken over rice) is pretty generous for a price that is reasonable.

    This iteration of Hometown focuses the menu down to their very best dishes. The old place had boba milk teas available, but I don't think that's here this time around. What is around, however, are their classic dishes like hock meat over rice (sounds gross but is really, really good) and their spicy beef noodle soup. Both of these along with the chicken plate are my go-to's whenever I come to Hometown. Each entree is around 10 bucks - which is a fair price.

    There is only one cook in the restaurant, so if it gets crowded (as it tends to do), be prepared to wait a while for your dish. You can tell by the amount of people who come here that the food really is as good as billed. Also, the restaurant is mainly populated by Asians... which also tells you something about how their food is!

    I certainly recommend Hometown as it is one of my Davis favorites!

    don't let the name fool you. HOCK meat is good!

    big 'ol chicken plate.

  • Brian G.

    Elite '2021

    Sacramento, CA
    561
    526
    619
    11/10/2018
    3 photos

    I never have high expectations for Chinese food in Davis but Hometown recently moved to a new location (next to Blondie's) with a revamped menu. I decided to give it a try and I enjoyed the food!

    It's an oddly organized restaurant, as you order at the cashier and sit down like Cafe style. Not to mention that it's attached to a bar/dance club that I frequent occasionally! The number that they bring your order is on your receipt so be sure to keep that handy.

    We ordered the pork Meatball soup, chicken drumsticks over rice, and the pork hock over rice.

    Meatball soup: B+
    Tasty and the flavor in the broth and meatballs are there. Comes with 6 meatballs. With the cilantro it tastes a bit like Westlake soup so I like it. I think the soup could use another vegetable or ingredient for additional texture.

    Chicken drumstick over rice: A-
    Chicken was cooked perfectly! Slightly crispy skin and super juicy meat. Thought this dish was great and totally recommend it.

    Pork hock over rice: B
    Flavor of the pork was better than the chicken but the meat wasn't tender enough like braised pork belly. Savory and a little sweet.

    All rice plates come with rice with pork sauce, string beans, a tea hardboiled egg and pickled radish. Plenty of rice to fill you up and the sauce adds savory goodness. The egg is a little overcooked but is salty and delicious.

    Service is decent, and pretty quick. Portions are definitely filling for the price. Worth a try for some good Taiwanese cuisine right here in Davis!

    Food: 4/5
    Value: 4.25/5
    Service: 3.5/5
    Overall: 4/5

  • Emmeline W.

    Elite '2021

    Berkeley, CA
    238
    222
    580
    6/18/2019

    This is eons better than their previous location in Mansion Square. Don't know why their menu magically improved upon relocation, but I'm NOT MAD YO. Hometown, you retained your belovedly coarse customer service, your long ass wait times, AND your ever-so-slightly-sticky menus and stuffy atmosphere-- but your food? Quality just SKYROCKETED. AMAZING. LOVE IT. YOU DO YOU.

    Located in the gated area of Blondies--err, Parkside now, I guess--Hometown boasts traditional Taiwanese dishes in a sea of Davis Canto/mainland cuisine. Some items, authentic af, others, not so much; but growing up Taiwanese-American myself, I'm happy seeing some of my childhood dishes finally represented downtown. I usually get the pork chop with rice + tea combo. Not only a great deal, but super tasty ^_^

    PORK CHOP w/ RICE: The breading is crispy & seasoned well, adding amazing texture when combined w/ the juicy, fragrant pork underneath. The rice here is always fluffy, never dry-- perfect with the bit of stewed pork on top! This dish comes with stir-fried green beans & a tea egg. Generous portions here, so be ready to take home some leftovers.

    GREEN MILK TEA w/ WHITE BOBA: As for the tea, they haven't started cooking regular pearls yet, so I settled with white boba. A pretty standard green milk tea. Satisfying, but nothing to write home about. I prefer Honey D's.

    The only two glaring negatives would probably be 1. the wait and 2. parking. For a restaurant that's not even 1/3 full, waiting 40+ minutes for 2 dishes is kind of an eternity. Lol. Apparently there's only one chef. And since it's in downtown, not the best parking prospects. I'd recommend just taking the bus.
